Class DisplayTransitionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • DisplayTransitionHelper

  • public class DisplayTransitionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    class DisplayTransitionHelper

    Helps DisplayableWindows calculate variations and gradients.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Stanley Sisson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double a
      The start and end values for the curve.
      protected double b
      The start and end values for the curve.
      protected InterpolationType interpolation
      The type of interpolation to use to find the intermediate values.
      protected int location
      The current time, or "location" on the timeline.
      protected int time
      The time it takes to get from value a to b, or visa-versa.
      protected boolean upward
      whether values are increasing if time is increasing or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayTransitionHelper

        public DisplayTransitionHelper(double start,
                               double end,
                               int time,
                               int startTime,
                               InterpolationType interpolation)
        Constructor for DisplayTransitionHelper

        Creates a new DisplayTransitionHelper to create transitions between the values of start and end over time frames.

        Parameters:
        start - The a or starting value.
        end - The b or ending value.
        time - The amount of time it should take to vary between a and b.
        startTime - The value in the timeline to start at. If this value is negative, it will start at that magnitude decreasing. If it is larger than time, then it well be set to the maximum value of time.
        interpolation - The type of interpolation between values a and b.

    • Method Detail

        Gets the current time within the transition.
        Returns:

      • reverseDirection

        public void reverseDirection()
        Reverses this DisplayTransitionHelper's direction from increasing to decreasing, or visa versa.

      • setIncreasing

        public void setIncreasing()
        Sets this DisplayTransitionHelper to increasing.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Processes one tick of time. Call this every frame (Display.FPS times per second).

        The location will increase or decrease based on if it is moving in the upward direction or not.
